Reviews.Title: “small rooms but clean, great location, nice staff, wasn't expensive”
Reviews.Author: brubru83
Reviews.Content: i was in paris in november 2011 for work. i stayed at the westin and at the champs-eylsees. i would pick this hotel over the westin any day and this was more affordable. it's clean, the staff is nice, it's a great location. sure, the rooms are small but it's updated and in way better shape than the westin.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Nice room but Expensive”
Reviews.Author: tjuney
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on 31st March 2011 for a night. Lift is very small, probably fits only 1-2 people with luggage. Considered it as modern, room is small, but nice. You have pay a deposit to rent the adapters, 15 euros if i didn't rmb wrongly. Friendly Staff, but not very helpful. Paid 149 Euros for a night.

Reviews.Title: “dont believe the pictures or the 4 stars rating”
Reviews.Author: marceloch
Reviews.Content: very small 11m2 , expensive for what it offers ... look elsewhere when in paris ... will not return and recommend to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Almost a 'Stella' experience on Rue d'Artois”
Reviews.Author: TheHighrise
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a fair trek from Gare du Nord if you're arriving by Eurostar (about 12 Euros if you're off-peak and know where you're going, 25 if you get stuck in the rush hour with a dithering cabbie) but once you're there it's pretty central, being just off the Champs Elysees. Check-in was pain free and if you can squeeze yourselves and your luggage into the compact and bijou lift, you'll be in your room in no time. The rooms are clean and modern with plenty of storage space and a great bathroom with shower. Tea-making resources were a bit on the sparse side for the British visitor, but there is a great little shop up the road which sells teabags and milk (and Oreos, Doritos and Mountain Dew - those great French staples!) We did however spend the first two nights being kept awake by the aggressive and extremely noisy aircon which - despite the high-tech panel - is actually controlled by reception. There should be some indication above the switch that this is the case. We didn't open the windows because of the traffic noise (the double-double glazing is very effective at keeping out the tooting and parping...) so it was a bit warm, but probably only at the height of summer. The neighbourhood is smashing - we found lovely Italian and Indian restaurants for evening meals and several typical Parisian caffs for breakfast, but if you can't do without your skinny latte and seaweed rolls there's a Starbucks just round the corner and plenty of sushi joints. There's even an English pub (The Bowler) opposite the shop if you miss your warm beer and KP nuts. All in all an enjoyable stay (apart from the aircon noise) in a cute hotel in a wonderful and romantic city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but quite compact!”
Reviews.Author: wackojacko007
Reviews.Content: I took ages trying to find a suitable hotel for a few nights midweek stay in Paris and finally settled on this hotel. The location of the hotel is excellent it is very close to a metro station and within easy walking distance of many of the main tourist attractions of Paris, the downside to this of course means that it is on a busy corner of a narrow street with traffic passing night and day. However, the double glazing works fine and the room is very quiet during the night except for the odd car horn or boy racer with a loud exhaust. We had no problems at all with music from any nearby nightclubs / bars that other reviewers had mentioned although we were on a mid week stay rather than a weekend. The outside of the hotel is nothing spectacular to look at but once inside it is a quiet and calming oasis with a modern clean and well decorated interior, although the reception area is quite small. All of the people we met on reception were friendly and helpful and they spoke excellent English which was good as I do not speak very good French although my feeble attempts did appear to be appreciated. As other reviewers mentioned the elevator is tiny and two people with bags will easily fill it, I can't see this being too much of a problem as I didn't intend spending too much time in the elevator any way. As with the reception area, our room (a Superior type) was very modernly decorated and very clean, although it was a little dark due to the colour scheme. The room was small but perfectly adequate as we did not spend much time in it anyway. Although I don't think I would have wanted the standard room as they were slightly smaller still. The ensuite bathroom was very nicely decorated with excellent quality modern fittings (shower but no bath) very compact but perfectly useable. I had requested a quiet room 'not on the ground floor or near the elevator' and we were placed on the 4th floor probably as far from the elevator as the size of the hotel could allow. Unfortunately we did seem to be located very close to the cleaners cupboard and had annoying noises disturbing us from quite early each morning. The hotel was very quiet during the night apart from the annoying guests who have not learnt how to close a door without slamming it (not the hotels fault of course) The biscuit situation - disappointed to say the least. On arrival there were just two teabags and one, yes one! tiny carton of milk. I know the French do not drink tea like the English but a small gesture of a few extra tea bags and milk would have been nice. There were also only two carboard biscuits in the room which for a 4* hotel seems a bit tight. All of this was of course resolved with a quick visit to the local Supermarket to pick up a good supply. We did leave a pile of tea bag wrappers on the side hoping that they would take the hint but sadly they never.The rooms were left spotless by the cleaners each day and the beds were comfortable with good quality linen. We could only receive about 6 tv channels, of which only two were in English, again this was not a real issue as I didn't come to France to watch t.v. We can not comment on the breakfast as we did not eat at the hotel (and it was 18 euro's per person which at first I thought sounded high but once you get outside you realise it's about the norm for Paris) One mention of the air conditioning, it works very well and it does need to as the rooms get very hot, however we did not want to open the windows due to street noise, but the alternative is to receive a blast of cold air directly over one side of the room so if you have any flesh on show it will probably get iced. The control panel in the room does not actually turn the air con off, this has to be done at reception. It may have been an idea for them to put up a small notice in the room to advise this. A Word of caution, on arrival at Gare du Nord we caught a Taxi to the hotel, it took about 20 mins and cost around 12 euros. We asked the hotel to call us a taxi for the return journey and I noticed the meter in the taxi was set 4 euros higher at the start of the journey. With delays in traffic it cost 25 euros to do the same trip! I'm not sure if its a bit of a con to start the meter higher or if there is some agreement between hotels and Taxi firm? Overall a very enjoyable stay, I am a light sleeper so perhaps others would not be disturbed by the noises that kept waking me up. I would recommend this Hotel to anyone for a short stay but I did find it slightly claustraphobic due to its dark decor and size.

Reviews.Title: “Very small but classy & clean with an acceptable location”
Reviews.Author: LGhaznawi
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one week with my sister & had a twin bedroom (we were a group of adults) - Clean & neat: The room was very clean when we first check-in but in the daily cleaning routine I had to keep asking for clean towels, sheets .. etc. I liked the fact that smoking & pets are not allowed as they badly affect the place hygiene. - Decoration: the rooms decoration is different & elegant in a new way. I went in very hot summer so I used the AC and it was very good however only the receptionist can control the temperature for you. - Friendly staff: We kept emailing for weeks before I confirmed my booking & got the room. The receptionist is also the concierge, the bar tender & the waitress which was a new concept to me but I found this as a common practice in Paris hotels. - Toilets: that's important to me! New & well equipped, I loved it. However, as a Muslim we prefer toilets in which we can use the shower to wash after, you know, using the toilet and in this hotel this wasn't feasible by any means as the water sources were away of the toilet seat. In one of the rooms I tried (I missed my flight & went back for 2 days & stayed in 2 different rooms) the place of the toilet seat was away & totally separate from the rest of the bathroom which wasn't convenient. - Location: the name fooled me, I thought it'll be closer to Champs Elysee but it was like 7-10 minutes walk but that was pretty much okay. there's a Starbucks & grocery at walkable distances too. - Hotel Size: it was shocking to see a 4 star hotel in this small size! Each floor may have maximum 6 rooms and the rooms' spaces, the lobby and the elevator are small. - Value for money: We paid at different rates, all were around 285-310 euros which I consider expensive for such a small hotel! You can find it cheaper online if you made an early booking. - Noise: there wasn't lots of noise but u know if someone is drunk and shouting in the street, or if another stupid person kept on using his car horn at midnight, sure u will hear them. - Internet WiFi was available for free & it was good

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Allhart88
Reviews.Content: Charming, clean hotel close to it all and the metro. Staff was helpful and spoke great English. Quiet rooms as they have double windows.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Little Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravelersVR
Reviews.Content: My partner booked this hotel as a surprise birthday present for me and I couldn’t have been happier. We arrived at night and were greeted by very friendly, happy staff. The hotel was decorated in an Art Deco style with an original looking 2 person glass lift that ran up the middle of a spiral staircase. Our room was a good size, en suite with a rain shower. It felt cosy and romantic as it was decorated in chocolate brown colours which gave a sumptuous feel. The breakfast area was in the basement, very nicely decorated and the waitress greeted you and served your coffee on arrival. The bar area was very small and the drinks were very expensive so I wouldn’t recommend staying in. We really enjoyed our stay in Paris and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away from this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cherise66
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very tiny. Website pictures are misleading. Elevator does not work half the time and can only accomodate two persons at a time with no luggages. The hallway is dinggy with not enough lighting. Showers in the bathroom does not have doors so the floor gets wet all the time. Very loud music from the club across the street can be heard until early morning. Breakfast is expensive. Not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Moonpiedream
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel without some of the amenities you would find in a larger hotel, such as a beauty salon or spa. Staff, however, can arrange many such services at nearby businesses. The decor is a charming art nouveau style and the rooms are comfortable and quiet. The location was very convenient to the major tourist attractions, and there were many boulangeries, restaurants and clubs within walking distance. Every member of the desk staff was genuinely friendly and helpful. It had been quite a while since I had been to Paris and my office booked the hotel. For that reason, I do not have a good perspective on hotel rates in Paris. I do believe, however, that this hotel was exceedingly expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, Quaint & Cozy”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie04
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night~ so we hit the ground running & sight seeing. So once we returned for the evening to rest, it was nice to come back to a beautiful Hotel lobby and great room~ Bed was comfy, the restroom was great~ very modern decor~ the front desk staff were amazing~ very helpful and friendly. We were within walking distance from the city center~So from the time we arrived and to our departure, we had a wonderful experience~ If I had to come back to this Hotel, I would do it in a heartbeat!! highly recommend a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely in Every Way”
Reviews.Author: ohlanier
Reviews.Content: A charming hotel with staff to match located in the center of everything. The room was comfortable and beautifully decorated as was the bathroom. The staff was friendly, helpful and attentive to every detail. Breakfast was generous and delicious. The friendly staff and charming atmosphere will bring me back.

Reviews.Title: “C'est Magnifique!!!”
Reviews.Author: nataliewong1980
Reviews.Content: Contrary to very few negative opinions we've seen of this hotel, we loved this place! Yes, the rooms are small, but HELLO!!! You are in Paris. If you like staying in a real boutique hotel, that's not commercialized and mass made, this would be the perfect example. The rooms are very clean, very modern, packed with lots of charm and clean lines.. no details were spared, and every space in the room was well utilized. The shower was nice to come home to, the toilet was separate from the bathroom (a definite plus for those travelling as a couple). And your room gets made every day. What we really appreciated was the fact that you don't get housemaids knocking at early hours at your door for housekeeping. Since you leave your room keys with them when you leave, they discretely do the cleaning while you are out. That's a BIG plus since we are on vacation mode. We were here for 7 nights and stayed on the top floor, and it was such a cute view of Rue d'Artois. Windows were double insulated, and definitely kept the noise from busy Rue La Boetie outside. Location was FANTASTIC! We were basically just right off of the famous Champs Elysees... and little did we know.... Rue du Fauborg St Honore was right behind us too!!! Also it was literally a hop, skip and a jump to the Metro Station St Philippe Du Roule. We couldn't ask for more in a location. And the best part was, we managed to get everywhere 80% of the time, on FOOT! Service was fantastic! We got to meet the owner.. she didn't speak much English, but was so kind. The receptionists at all shifts were helpful and catered to all of our needs. Our guy was Erick. He was the receptionist / barista, and kept us company till the wee hours of the morning in engaging conversation. Restaurants you definitely need to try, since they're just a stone's throw away from the hotel: Japonais Barbecue ( right next door, Yakiniku was the BOMB!) Crepes Des Champs Elysees (AUTHENTIC French crepes on Rue de Berri) Laduree (for those macaron enthusiasts, and French fare) Also, on Rue La Boetie, there are some really quaint mom and pop shoe stores, Rudy's and Theirry 21 that have affordable and comfortable shoes made in Spain or Italy without blowing your budget. All in all, Hotel Des Champs Elysees was our home away from home in Paris. We loved it and will definitely come back =)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: gem125
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights and were really impressed. The rooms were very clean and I think recently refubished so were to a good standard - very nice bathroom. The location was perfect, very close to the Metro and a 2 minute walk from the Champs Elysees. We did not have breakfast included in our rate but felt that the price for the room was very reasonable considering the location and quality of accomodation particularly in comparison to other options we looked at. The only negative for us was that we could not seem to get the air con to work and there was a lot of street noise with the window open but we should have got the air con sorted! Overall I would definately recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: BrianOjai
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a 6 nights recently and had a great experience. Good sized rooms (esp. for Paris). Great location, close to several Metro stops. Friendly staff and comfortable room.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: cbel32
Reviews.Content: I would have to say that my Fiance and I really enjoyed our stay in Paris. This hotel is perfectly located near the metro's and main attractions i.e. Champs Élysées. Room was small but perfect since we spent very little time there. Breakfast was a bit over priced at 18 euro per day/per person, staff was great and really helped to make your time enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff, excellent location, very modern and clean, great value!”
Reviews.Author: BobbNHUSA
Reviews.Content: The staff at Hotel des Champs Elysees, Reuben, Sandrine, and Frederick in particular, were most helpful with whatever needs we had, from assisting with metro and train lines, store and banking locations, booking a dinner reservation or cruise, recommending restaurants, etc. The young lady who assisted in the breakfast room and the cleaning staff were also very friendly and helpful. My sister and I arrived early in the morning, long before check in time, and Reuben locked our suitcases in a secure room until we arrived much later in the afternoon. He took the suitcases to the room before we returned and upgraded our room because of the more than sufficient number of suitcases we had brought on our trip. As a result, our room was very spacious and was very clean. He was always very polite and willing to assist us with metro routes to use to get to our destinations. Sandrine was also very helpful and patient with our many requests. She recommended an excellent French cuisine restaurant and made the reservations for us and also called ahead to another restaurant one evening when we were running late. Additionally, she made arrangements for a wonderful dinner cruise down the Seine our last night in Paris. Another staff member who was always smiling and very patient with assisting us was Frederick. He assisted Sandrine with next morning train schedules one evening as she was staying late to give us the info, and he wasn't even scheduled to work that day. Most everyone at the hotel spoke English, a definite plus! The location was excellent; we walked to most of the local tourist attractions, shopping areas, post office, and restaurants. The only drawback was that the computer in the sitting area was not working and I would have to use the one at the desk and limited my time as the staff needed it for completing their affairs. I definitely recommend this hotel if it is within your price range.

Reviews.Title: “Modern,clean,comfortable and well located.”
Reviews.Author: LKC008
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights in July end. It had everything I look for in a room.: 1. Cleanliness: The room was spotless. Towels, sheets very clean. 2. Comfort : Beds were extremely comfortable, fluffy pillows. It has effective air conditioning. Loads of hot water. Clean bathroom. Basically a pleasure to come back after a long tiring day. 3. Location : Short walk to the metro. 5 -7 min walk to Champs Elysees. Lots of eating places nearby. Infact we had an awesome meal at Misia. There is a big bakery nearby where we ate breakfast everyday. Some nice places to party nearby. 4. Service : The woman at the desk was really helpful. She helped us with which Metro to take, where to eat and even helped us to book tickets for a play we wanted to see. The staff at the hotel goes out of their way to help you. Extremely happy with our stay here. I would definitely stay here again if I come back to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location!”
Reviews.Author: smasonrn
Reviews.Content: The Hotel des Champs Elysees is a delightful boutique hotel in the 8th arrondisement of Paris. It is 1 block from the metro and about a 10 minute walk to the Champs Elysees. The staff was courteous and helpful with dirrections. The hotel was decorated in a charming style and was as immaculately clean. The room in which we stayed was small but comfortable, and the bathroom was very modern. We did not have the breakfast, which whas 18e per person, but there were several coffee shops in the area, as well as a Starbucks 3 blocks away. We were able to negotiate a better price for staying an entire week, which was helpful because hotels in Paris are tres cher!! Our only complaint would be that it can be noisy outside at night if you want to open the windows. All in all, it was a wonderful home base for a week of sightseeing in the City of LIghts!

Reviews.Title: “Good in parts!”
Reviews.Author: N_S_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in 502 - deluxe room. Plus points: Hotel is well situated for Champs Elysees and Metro, Friendly and helpful attitude amongst staff. Well decorated and stylish. Air conditioned. Kettle and cups. Minibar. Wifi Internet. Minus points: Not so good for quiet. Traffic seemed to get backed up in the street outside leading onto the Champs Elysees leading to impatient tooting throughout the night. Very firm beds. Small size room with tiny bathroom, ok for one person, not great for two. Very modern light switches awkward to use. Poor quality towels. Questionable value for money.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite Paris hotel :)”
Reviews.Author: chuffed-california
Reviews.Content: What more could one ask for... great location, great value, super clean, and friendly staff. This is now my favorite Paris hotel. I stayed in a superior room, # 401. Room size is perfect, (well for a solo traveller). Closet is huge with double mirrored doors. Decor is unique and bed is clean and super comfortable. Electric kettle, spoons, coffee cups, and glasses made having breakfast in the room a breeze. Free Wi-Fi was fast and reliable. Lots of shelving in closet and a safe. Water closet separate from bathroom which was nice. Location: minutes from Virgin Megastore and the Monoprix on the Champs Elysees. Supermarket was down the street and a very nice cafe was across the street. A Velib station was conveniently down the street. The metro (Saint-Philippe du-Roule) was a minute away with a very convenient presse stand. My room overlooked the courtyard so it didn't have a view per se, but it was quiet which was what I asked for. Air conditioning worked wonderfully; Only wished the TV had HD programming and more channels. Staff were so friendly and sweet - the 2 gentlemen (tres mignon) always spoke to me in English which made me feel at home instantly. If you want a clean hotel with all the amenities, very friendly staff, and want the best value for your money, then this is your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “You won't be disappointed with this...”
Reviews.Author: XMX0102
Reviews.Content: You won't be disappointed with this little gem of a hotel. We stayed for a one night weekend break in early 2010. It truely is a boutique hotel in the most fabulous of locations.... Two minutes walk and you are on the Champs d'Elysees. Our room was furnished to a fantastic standard. We didn't eat in the hotel as it was a one night stop over so we had breakfast on the Champs d'elysees Well wouldn't you ;) Great hotel, great location and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff and inviting rooms topped off by a superb location”
Reviews.Author: BushNomad
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located 2 minutes from the Champs-Elysees in a quiet street with great access to most of Paris' main attractions. Rooms are comfortable and well equipped. Room space is minimal and lift is cozy with 2 people but this is to be expected for cetral Paris. I upgraded to deluxe room for a bit extra and this was more than adequate. Buffet style breakfast was varied and of good quality. Hotel staff were polite and helpful during and after 1 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “A well located boutique hotel in Paris with charm and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: bch1950
Reviews.Content: We did a lot of searching on the internet for a hotel within a short walk of the Champs, with modern rooms at prices that were reasonable (for Paris) and certainly found what we were loooking for. It was for my Wife, son and daughter-in-law and myself to celebrate my 60th birthday (two rooms) and so it was important to get everything "right". The Hotel met all of our expectations, even putting my son and his Wife in an upgraded deluxe room because it was available early on the day they arrived, well before normal check-in time. In Paris, in summer, it really is necessary to have a good air-conditioning system, which the Hotel has, so it was always comfortable. Great staff, always friendly and all with excellent English,

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: dillon2158
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel in a great, convenient location. Quiet, wll furnished rooms and bathrooms with very pleasant, helpful staff. Checking in and out very easy, lift is small if you have lots of luggage, beds are extremely comfortable, rooms are quiet considering it is on a busy street. Rue d'Artois is only a few minutes walk to the Champs Elysees - do use the underpass to access the Arc de Triomphe, we spent time just watching the traffic! Paris was excellent, very easy to get around if you like lots of walking. Handy tour bus stops at all the main attractions. Musee d' Orsay (as featured on Dr Who) is fantastic, we spent nearly the whole day looking at pictures, sculptures, etc. Only just left some time for the Louvre - easy to cross the Seine and walk through a lovely park. Prices in Paris are high but I'm sure if we had spent time looking for cheaper options we could have found them - but when you are only there for 4 days and may never visit again you tend to stay in the main attractions!

Reviews.Title: “a Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: yesvol
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at this lovely hotel and we had great time. The location of the hotel is superb, it is 2 minutes walk from Champs-Elysees avenue. Price is reasonable, room was very-well furnished and both the room and the bathroom were very clean. The staff were very nice and friendly. I will definitely prefer this hotel for another stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was a great find- -you will not be disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: OdieShu
Reviews.Content: My son (age 25) and I spent a fabulous week in Paris with the Hôtel Des Champs Elysées as our home base. What a great little hotel! The staff was super friendly and helpful. My research on Trip Advisor prepared me for the size of the room, so it turned out to be not as tiny as I had expected. Nice little closet with a few small shelves, but no drawers for clothing, so had to leave a lot of things in my suitcase. As everyone mentions, the location is absolutely superb. A metro station is right around the corner, and we made good use of it every day. The area is also prime walking territory and there are some terrific bistros right in the neighborhood (less expensive than on the Champs Elysees). The bathroom was small but very nicely appointed and the toilet was private and separated from the bathroom, which was convenient for mother and son traveling together. The free in-room WIFI was awesome as I got sick of CNN after a while. The weather was quite warm and sunny while we were there, so the air conditioned room was really important for us spoiled Americans. This hotel was a great find, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: katmuzik
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there and we highly recommend it. The staff were very welcoming and our room was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: RGS1228
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights at this great little hotel in late April. The location is terrific, within walking distance of Champs-Elysees and other attractions. The rooms are small, but the bed was comfortable and the shower was great! The price was very reasonable and the Staff was very helpful, particularly Rueben, who went out of his way to assist! The continental breakfast is excellent and well worth the additional charge. We will stay at this Hotel again on our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Central and Top”
Reviews.Author: kuboskin
Reviews.Content: Everything was great. Personnel very friendly. Breakfast can be ordered to the room at no charge. Stayed for 5 nights and really enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel in a perfect city!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: thewrinkla
Reviews.Content: this hotel is a must when staying in paris. location is perfect, just off the champs elysees. the staff are very friendly and helpful, from advising on where to go & what to see, to booking restaurants for you. the room we stayed in was very clean & for a change was exactly as shown on the website. an all round top experience in a top city!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Paris boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Run42K
Reviews.Content: Overall, my wife and I were pleasantly surprised by this quaint, boutique art deco style hotel. Rooms are petit, yet cozy and extremely quiet. The hotel location is a short 5 minute walk to the Champs- Elysees and 10 minutes to the Arc de Triomphe de l'Étoile .The front desk staff were extremely helpful assisting with recommendations and securing dining reservations. The housekeeping staff was friendly and the breakfast room attendant was wonderful! Breakfast was continental fare, yet consisted of numerous hot and cold choices. The breakfast upgrade was very cost worthy and filling for long sightseeing days. The rooms were well decorated and immaculately clean. The bathrooms terrific, very modern and I particularly enjoyed the shower pebble floor and LED ceiling. The flat screen television only offered two English speaking channels "BBC World News" and "CNN", but the free high bandwidth Wi-Fi, enabled web streaming TV and more than compensated. We were extremely impressed with the boutique hotel and would definitely return for a subsequent stay and recommend it to anyone visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “'A Little Gem'”
Reviews.Author: ilana613
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel by chance and checked it out on Trip Advisor before booking it. I couldn't have been more happy with my choice. The hotel is tiny but perfect especially in a city where you spend as little time in your hotel as possible, so the small rooms were not an issue. We took three rooms and all were slightly different. The thing that I liked the best were the very friendly and courteous service from the front desk, a stark contrast to the hotel that my friend stayed in near the Marais. I have stayed at the famous George V before but this is the place I will return to the next time I visit Paris. It is two minutes walk from the Champs Elysees and about five minutes from Place de la Madaleine for great shopping!!

Reviews.Title: “A great team in a small but nice hotel with modern rooms”
Reviews.Author: enrico1982
Reviews.Content: It's a small hotel less than 5 minutes away from the world famous Champs-Elysees. The staff there is outstanding, very friendly and we even got a free room upgrade for our stay over valentines day. The rooms are pretty small but they're very modern, stuffed with high tech and an amazing bathroom with LED sky-view. The rooms were very clean and it was great to stay there, even the small elevator (max 3 people that know each others). We didn't have breakfast there but you would've the opportunity. Oh and we also got great advice for restaurants or shops in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, tiny rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Kelzers
Reviews.Content: All in all the hotel did not disappoint, but on the other-hand did not amaze. The hotel is pleasantly decorated in a cozy art-deco style. The hotel is however a little compact and bijoux!! Rooms in particular are fairly tiny, however this is to be expected in a 4* establishment in Paris! In fairness, we were offered a discounted upgrade to a suite, but declined. We found housekeeping staff to be exceptionally warm and friendly, the lady who looks after the breakfast room in particular was wonderful! Front desk staff were efficient and satisfied our requests in a friendly manner, but could have done with being just a little warmer for my personal liking. Breakfast was the typical continental fayre, which we found tasty and satisfying. The rooms were well decorated and immaculately clean. The bathrooms in particular were lovely, very modern and slick. Complimentary toiletries were extremely limited though, a small shampoo and shower gel were the only choices available. The television only offered one English speaking channel "BBC World News". The lift was extremely small but I found it to be quaint and in keeping with the style of the hotel. Whilst the hotel is not located directly on the Champs- Elysees (this is a 5 minute stroll away), the location is still very good. The hotel offers free wifi which we found to be a welcome bonus. All things considered I was impressed with the hotel and would return for another stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: yousmo
Reviews.Content: Located just two blocks from the Champs Elysees, this is a really nice hotel. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Rooms are a little on the small side but I think that is pretty common for Paris. HIghly recommend Julien's Patiserrie just around the corner for breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Paris”
Reviews.Author: hgolchha
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay at Des Champs Elysees. The staff was very friendly. We had taken our 3yr old son with us. The location was perfect. We could walk around and come back to the hotel frequently.They gave us a large room so we could be comfortable.Thanks to the hotel we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: joycyc
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel and an excellent location with very comfortable and technological rooms

Reviews.Title: “Encroiable!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ashram73
Reviews.Content: I spend 4 days in this little precious hotel and everything was quite perfect. From the very first day until the end all was magic, and more "encroiable" due to the kindness of the crew at the front desk that help me to made my 4 days in Paris unforgettable... Definitely I'll come back next year, looking forward to have another pleasent stay there...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SuperLondonTravel
Reviews.Content: Beautifully decorated, service was excellent, great location, maybe the rooms were a bit small but thought the hotel was great....thoroughly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Tres bien”
Reviews.Author: katrinaWinnipeg
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful little hotel. I was coming from a convention in Barcelona and actually wanted to go to Zurich on my Aeroplan ticket. They could only find me a couple of days in Paris. You have to understand the last time I was in Paris was in 1980 and myself and my ex had a terrible time and left for Provence. ( Which was wonderful) This time I was alone. The hotel staff were incredible. They helped me find not only the tourist things but also great places to eat. They encouraged me to practice my somewhat limited French. The rooms were marvellous; small but well contained. The cute little bathroom was brand new and had the greatest little shower and doors that opened in to the street. it also had these different coloured little lights on the ceiling that kept changing, which had I had a partner would havebeen very romantic. There were also double doors from my room which had a very comfortable bed. The lighting system worked well and I could switch any light on/off from my bedside. The breakfast, although somewhat limited, had the most wonderful croissants and cafe latte. The breakfast room was downstairs with stone walls and modern furniture was a wonderful contrast from the old to the new. Finally, the location was only 2 blocks from the Champs D' Elysee and all the upscale shops like Cartier. The street was quiet and I was glad I didn't have a hotel right on the Champs. Being a woman alone, it was a very safe place to walk alone at night. I think the hotel and the staff there helped me fall in love with Paris. Maybe that is why I had to come to Paris...

Reviews.Title: “They can do better ..”
Reviews.Author: LeoCPH
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights. I did a lot of business trip to Paris and I always tried to stay at boutique hotels rather than chain hotels. I must say this hotel did not live up to the expectation. At least with the price I had to pay, they could do better than that. By the way, I paid 195 euros per night without breakfast. That's comparable with Bassano or Elysee Regencia, other boutique hotels around the area. For start, the best part were the location and the room. The location is perfect to enjoy Paris. The room is well decorated although the lighting was quite annoying to operate (a bit over the top to be honest). Again, I wouldn't be complaining if I didn't have to pay that much. I paid 195 euros per night for classic room but got upgrade to superior room. But even for the superior room, it was too expensive. The room was basic, no coffee maker, the bathroom was small but clean and only had shampoo and shower gels. The hotel was under staffed. I had to go down to the reception to take the iron (and they don't have ironing board). I ordered for room service, the food arrived 1.5 hours later. That's quite annoying as I only ordered a sandwich. The room is quite well sound proofed from outside noise, but not from inside! I could hear door slam noise from the room next door. I guess it's because the door system is not well maintained so it was difficult to close the door without making loud sound. Overall, it was a bit disappointment. I would not stay at this hotel again. It's a shame though since they have potential to be a great place to stay. I would recommend this hotel only if you could get cheaper rate as the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Bit of a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: HotelNoirAdmin
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with loads of potential but they badly let themselves down by simple things. We were given a lovely room with excellent doble glazing overlooking the street so we had a vibrant view, but could block out the noise. Room was nicley done with a compact but excellent bathroom. All well until the first morning when they cleaned the toilets next to our room at 7am with much banging of the brush against the toilet side, and then got a delivery which went into the cupboard opposite our room - took them 1.5 hours to take it all in and the door must have slammed shut 100 times. We gave in and got up. Reception was fairly unconcerned but offered us a free upgrade - seemed like a reasonable answer until we went into the "superior" room. It was a third smaller with a smaller bed and similar bathroom. It overlooked an air venting system covered in cigarette ends. Someone had thoughfully placed some plants there to beautify the area and then not watered them for about 3 years... Why was this a superior room??? - because it was at the back of the hotel! There wasn't any noise at the front so we failed to see why this qualified but met the brick wall which comes about if you have any real issue at the hotel. They weren't interested at all and refused to do anything. We asked them not to charge our card until the elusive manager called us, which they agreed to but the minute we left the premises they charged the card. On complaint from UK, they sent us a mail saying that they do not offer refunds under any circumstances. Other small irritations like staff who are disinterested and haven't a clue on things such as what wine they sell, or where crazy items like glasses might be stored, and a bar which was shut the entire time we stayed there (4 days) but overall, they aren't really interested in anything beyond getting you (and your card details) in the door and then leaving you to it. A real shame for such a nice property.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel we stayed at in france”
Reviews.Author: lil_kissy
Reviews.Content: we booked this hotel based on reviews on tripadvisor. we stayed for four nights. the room was immaculate and we really liked the decor. we booked a classic room, and were double upgraded upon arrival, which was very much appreciated. the location was fantastic, and there were so many restaurants, shops, a little supermarket, and even movie theaters in just a short walking distance. the metro is also close by. there is wireless internet service in the hotel as well, with no extra charge. as for complaints others have made, yes the elevator is small as were the rooms. but that is the norm in europe. and the toilet being separate from the shower/sink, we also found that in other hotels as well. and we found it to be very quiet. the only minor complaint we had was a little mix up with a restaurant reservation, but we just took care of it ourselves easily. i would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, except for the tiny elevator ...”
Reviews.Author: mariasilvestre
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is cosy, very trendy. The receptionist is very nice and polite, such as the lady at the breakfast room. A bit pricey but being so close to the Champs Elysées is normal and of course Paris is very expensive. Overall I enjoyed it very much.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the elegance of the overall ambiance”
Reviews.Author: amera77
Reviews.Content: I thought the hotel was very charming, with a touch of modern sophistication... The staff was very helpful and welcoming and I felt like the place was my home. i got a lot of brilliant ideas for redecorating my apartment from the simple techiques they used in their interior decoration. the place was near everything i needed and very accesible to the transportation stations i utilized throughout my trip... i will definitely be visiting it again next year! thanks to all the staff... incredible job! amera

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: yaz3005
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel. Great location near the Champs Elysees. Less than a minute from the tube. The room was fantastic.. Very comfortable, The bathroom was outstanding. ~Very modern and up-to-date. For a boutique hotel, I was pleasantly suprised. The staff was great. I highly recommend it,.

Reviews.Title: “A super hotel - good value, lovely rooms and great position”
Reviews.Author: Salop-Lass
Reviews.Content: This is a super hotel in a quiet road off the top of the champs elysees. The hotel is beautifully done out, with lovely relaxing decor and furnishing in the room, giving it a fresh, romantic feel. Rooms are very clean and the bedding etc all new. There are two metro stations within a very short walk giving accesibility to anywhere in Paris. This hotel is thoroughly recommended. Good value for the position and helpful friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice rooms, although expensive.”
Reviews.Author: vmpiyo
Reviews.Content: This is quite a small boutique hotel, so the lift is small (fits max 4 ppl)...which wasn't really a problem for us as we were only staying for 2 nights/3days. The hotel staff were very helpful, helped recommend us a nice French restaurant nearby called L'appart and also let us use the internet for online check in and print out our boarding pass without charge. The room we stayed in was a classic double, it was quite small however that wasn't a problem as the room was very clean, very nicely decorated and the bathroom (shower only) was very modern and clean as well. Our friends stayed in the superior double room, which was slightly bigger and had a bath tub, but I would recommend the classic room as they paid an extra £50 just for the tiny bit more space and bath tub...and as we only use shower and don't require that much space in a hotel...that suited us perfectly. Another thing about the shower...it had these changing led lights on the ceiling ..not much use but very nice! The street the hotel is on is relatively quiet, and lots of restaurants and cafes close by as well as a supermarket. We practically walked everywhere for the whole trip as the location is close to most main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “I will never stay here again”
Reviews.Author: kittykat09_9
Reviews.Content: I had a terrible experience when I stayed in this Hotel just recently. Although the Hotel is in a good location for sight seeing, I found the Hotel to be noisy,dark and dingy, with the smallest lift in Paris which at least once a day did not work. The Hotel staff were rude and gossiped about the guests, especially, Receptionist Elise; Night Receptionist Hassan, and Anne-Marie, who was responsible for the breakfast and cleanliness of the rooms. The breakfast was very poor value for the eighteen Euros that was asked. Very poor food selection, and the Danish and Croissants were frozen. Breakfast staff would not and did not know how to boil eggs. For a Four Star Hotel there were no facilities for Tea and Coffee making in the rooms, which is a requirement by law in France. There was no-one manning the Bar which is also a requirement for a Four Star establishment. I found this Hotel to be very poor value for money. I went to Paris for a special occasion and this experience at the Hotel spoilt it for me.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TheMushroomChild
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights, have no complaints whatsoever. Was perfect. Everything was really nicely decorated. The bed was comfy, shower was powerful, and there were changing coloured lights in the bathroom. Very modern. Rooms average sized for a city hotel. Very close to the champs elysees with 2 metros pretty close by making it really easy to get around. Breakfast was a buffet which was quite expensive but we had it included in our package and it filled us up till half way through the day. The woman filling it up constantly kept it full. For some reason one day we only got new towels and the room never got cleaned but maid came back at about 5 and apologised and offered to clean it. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: mmmm70
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for two nights while in Paris to get engaged, totally perfect - rooms and bathrooms are spotless, staff are friendly and the location amazing. Perfect base for seeing the sights. Yes rooms are quite small but this is Paris and for all the time spent in the room its more than adequate.

Reviews.Title: “very good location”
Reviews.Author: colorfull
Reviews.Content: very good location few minutes to the champs-elysees by walk. Frinedly stuff and very helpfull, good breakfast, very clean hotel and nice decorate but the rooms are very very small. There is a grosary and pharmacy very close to the hotel, few steps. Things I didn't like that you have to order things like an iron or extra blanket only at the morning. Also, it's a littel nosey- you can hear the next room-. at all you feel it like yur home

Reviews.Title: “Top tip! - look no further...”
Reviews.Author: LondonMandK
Reviews.Content: We spent one night in Paris for our wedding anniversary and chose the hotel des Champs-Elysees based on other reviews we had read – and we were certainly glad we did! We are what may be called discerning travellers (and always on the lookout for a good boutique hotel) and we certainly cannot fault this place for any reason. Location, cleanliness, amenities, service, friendliness, size, cost, etc, all top class. We stayed in a deluxe room and certainly were not short of space (we had heard how cosy Paris hotel rooms can be). If this review helps just one more traveller decide to stay here, then we'll be happy enough. If you are on the lookout for a more luxury establishment, you will certainly find many in Paris, but to our minds, … yous pays your money, yous makes your choice…

Reviews.Title: “Found a great place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: GMGC
Reviews.Content: On our way to Charentes we decided to overnight in Paris. we bumped into Hotel des Champs Elysees by coincidence. It was a very pleasent surprise. We could park on the street in front of the hotel and for those who are less lucky, there is a covered parking nearby. The hotel is one block away from the Champs-Elysees nearby the Arc de Triumph. The rooms are beautiful and modern. We had interconnecting rooms which is very handy when you are travelling with kids. Breakfast was also a great way to start the day. Personnel is also very nice and helpful. I fully recommend this hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant gem in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: happy_vegemite_too
Reviews.Content: My daughter (18) and I spent 3 wonderful nights at this very chic hotel. The hotel is ideally located, a few minutes walk from both the Champs Elysees and the metro. The very stylish decor makes the room feel warm and inviting as does the hotel. We slept soundly and heard no traffic noise even though our room faced the road. Our superior room with twin beds was cleverly designed, the bathroom superb, a generous sized bath and interesting shower head that worked well. A very sophisticated easily operable lighting system is installed, wifi is free and worked effortlessly. We found every staff member very caring, polite and helpful, they all seemed extremely dedicated. There were no downsides to this elegant hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, fresh appealling decor, friendly service, central location”
Reviews.Author: justoff
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel, not far from all central locations. Staff are welcoming and friendly but not over-bearing, decor is fresh, new and modern, room has all amenities expected at this level including wireless access. All round excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: Blackwyvere
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect. Everything is right there. But the restaurants are a bit expensive, so if on a bugdet walk further away from the main streets. The staff are extremely polite & courteous. Excellent tips/hints. The downside to the place is, a bit small/cramped, which to an extend was ok! However, the most annoying bit was the lack of tea/coffee facilities in the room. That was expected, guess they want you to use their room service facility (which is not cheap). Apart from that, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: SAPStar
Reviews.Content: Small friendly boutique hotel. very nicely decorated, good air conditioning in the height of summer. 5 minutes from the Champs Elysees and the Arc du Triomphe. Very close to a Metro station and the RER. Rooms very nicely decorated in black and silver and very clean, modern bathrooms. Free wifi. Rooms are small, but it is the centre of Paris. Double, double glazing - very quiet. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: EmileGoss
Reviews.Content: The hotel provided excellent value for the money (given that the room was booked well in advance with a huge discount, otherwise a bit pricey), it has very clean interior and rooms (not too big, but quite alright for the standard in Paris!), also incredibly polite and helpful staff members (this was a pleasant surprise in Paris!), convenient location and perfect sound proofing from the street noise outside. Nice touches would be slippers in the room, bath rope and less expensive minibar...

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel des Champs-Elysees
HotelInfo.Address: 2, rue d'Artois | 08 Arr., 75008 Paris, France
